intro: Isatis virens, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual herb characterized by its bright yellow flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are borne in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. Isatis virens is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
